data.title: Tudela, Misamis Occidental Profile – PhilAtlas
data.meta_description: Tudela is a coastal municipality in the province of Misamis Occidental, Northern Mindanao region (Region X), Philippines. It has a population of 28,599 (2020 Census figures) distributed over 33 barangays.
data.text:
Tudela, Province of Misamis Occidental

Summary dataTypemunicipalityIsland groupMindanaoRegionNorthern Mindanao (Region X)ProvinceMisamis OccidentalBarangay count33Postal code7202Coastal/LandlockedcoastalMarine waterbodiesIligan Bay [Bohol Sea]Philippine major island(s)MindanaoArea (2013)87.34 km2 (33.72 sq mi)Population (2020)28,599Density (2020)327 / km2 (848 / sq mi)Coordinates8° 15' North, 123° 51' East (8.2430, 123.8454)Estimated elevation above sea level9.8 meters (32.2 feet)

Tudela is a coastal municipality in the province of Misamis Occidental.

The municipality has a land area of 87.34 square kilometers or 33.72 square miles which constitutes 4.35% of Misamis Occidental's total area. Its population as determined by the 2020 Census was 28,599. This represented 4.63% of the total population of Misamis Occidental province, or 0.57% of the overall population of the Northern Mindanao region. Based on these figures, the population density is computed at 327 inhabitants per square kilometer or 848 inhabitants per square mile.

Barangays

Tudela has 33 barangays as shown in the following table.

Economy

The annual regular revenue of Tudela for the fiscal year of 2016 was ₱86,240,820.60.

End notes:

Annual Regular Income = Locally Sourced Revenue + Internal Revenue Allotment (IRA) Current Year + Other Shares from National Tax Collection

Locally Sourced Revenue = Real Property Tax (General Fund) + Tax on Business + Other Taxes + Regulatory Fees + Service/User Charges + Receipts from Economic Enterprises

Demographics

Households

The household population of Tudela in the 2015 Census was 28,883 broken down into 6,573 households or an average of 4.39 members per household.

Population by age group

According to the 2015 Census, the age group with the highest population in Tudela is 5 to 9, with 3,079 individuals. Conversely, the age group with the lowest population is 80 and over, with 341 individuals.

Historical population

The population of Tudela grew from 11,057 in 1939 to 28,599 in 2020, an increase of 17,542 people over the course of 81 years. The latest census figures in 2020 denote a negative growth rate of 0.24%, or a decrease of 333 people, from the previous population of 28,932 in 2015.

details

Population of Tudela (1903‑2020)Census datePopulationGrowth rate1903 Mar 2––1918 Dec 31––1939 Jan 1––1948 Oct 111,4770.38%1960 Feb 1513,3611.35%1970 May 617,8772.89%1975 May 119,6251.89%1980 May 121,8932.21%1990 May 119,070-1.37%1995 Sep 122,8053.41%2000 May 123,0470.23%2007 Aug 125,1131.19%2010 May 127,3713.18%2015 Aug 128,9321.06%2020 May 128,599-0.24%

The total number of registered voters or electorate in Tudela for the year 2019 was 19,220, broken down into 9,549 males and 9,671 females.

Location

The municipal center of Tudela is situated at approximately 8° 15' North, 123° 51' East, in the island of Mindanao. Elevation at these coordinates is estimated at 9.8 meters or 32.2 feet above mean sea level.

Distances

Based on the great-circle distance (the shortest distance between two points over the surface of the Earth), the cities closest to Tudela are Ozamiz, Misamis Occidental, Tangub, Misamis Occidental, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Iligan, Marawi, Lanao del Sur, and Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur. The nearest municipalities are Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Kolambugan, Lanao del Norte, and Maigo, Lanao del Norte. Its distance from the national capital is 768.58 kilometers (477.57 miles). The following list delineates such distance measurements.

Notes
